item.title: Japan Airlines Plane in Flames After Collision at Tokyo's Haneda Airport
item.description: The passenger jet collided with a Japan Coast Guard plane on Tuesday evening local time, according to the country’s public broadcaster NHK.

item.title: Hong Kong Dissident's Tweets, Ties To Trump Officials Cited in National Security Trial
item.description: Prosecutors alleged media tycoon Jimmy Lai was the mastermind of a conspiracy to urge Western governments to sanction Chinese and Hong Kong officials. He pleaded not guilty to the charges.

item.title: LPs Doubt Venture Funds' Startup Valuations
item.description: Investors in venture funds are scrutinizing unrealized returns for overly optimistic projections, slowing down fundraising processes.

item.title: Dollar Firms as Market Awaits Data For Insight into Fed's Next Move
item.description: The dollar rose against a basket of currencies as the market awaits U.S. economic data releases this week for insight into the Fed’s next move, XS.com said.

item.title: Why Short Sellers Are Targeting Struggling EV Companies
item.description: Electric vehicle manufacturers like Lucid, Lordstown Motors and Faraday Futures were big winners of the stock boom two years ago. Now all three companies’ shares are about to hit zero.

item.title: How Often Should You Mess With Your 401(k)? More Than Before
item.description: Compulsively checking your 401(k) is seen by behavioral economists as the source of bad investment decisions. Right now, though, looking at your portfolio too seldom could equally lead to missed opportunities.

item.title: As CFOs Prepare for an Unpredictable 2024, Here's What Tops Their Checklists
item.description: From managing talent and controlling costs to monitoring macroeconomic trends and forging new partnerships, corporate finance chiefs are girding for volatility and uncertainty ahead.

item.title: Investors' Hope for 2024: A Return to Long-Lost Normalcy
item.description: Many think markets can find a more stable equilibrium after recent rate increases.

item.title: Wealthy Investors Rescued Juul From Bankruptcy. Others Are Crying Foul.
item.description: Two of Juul Labs’ longtime directors—a Hyatt Hotels heir and a venture capitalist—helped bail out the e-cigarette maker from the edge of insolvency. Now other investors are suing.

item.title: India's Food-Security Problem Is the World's, Too
item.description: India’s tightly controlled agricultural market has left food production highly vulnerable to climate change. That’s a global problem: India is a major food exporter.

item.title: Americans Are Canceling More of Their Streaming Services
item.description: Hulu and other streamers are turning to bundles, discounts and ad-supported plans as customer defections rise.

item.title: New Disruptions, Geopolitics Hang Over 2024 Supply Chains
item.description: Companies that assembled new supply chain strategies in the wake of the Covid-19 pandemic are having to put those plans into practice far faster than they may have thought possible.

item.title: Michigan May Win the National Championship. Help!
item.description: An overtime defeat of Alabama puts the Wolverines in the title game against Washington—and our Wisconsin-grad columnist mulling a move to an underground cave.

item.title: The Voters Who Decide Elections Don't Like What They See
item.description: In counties that backed the past four presidential winners, residents worry that America’s best days are behind it.

item.title: Republicans' Narrow Control of House Sets Up Barnburner in 2024
item.description: Both Republicans and Democrats see realistic paths on the November election map to win control of the House of Representatives.

item.title: Netherlands Blocks ASML Exports of Chip-Making Equipment to China
item.description: ASML said the Dutch government has blocked the company’s exports to China of some chip-making equipment in a partial license revocation following U.S. export restrictions.

item.title: Avangrid Ends Deal With PNM Resources
item.description: Iberdrola’s U.S. business, Avangrid, has ended a merger agreement with PNM Resources after rejecting the latest bid to extend the $4.3 billion deal reached in October 2020.

item.title: Metals Move Higher, With Support From Weaker Dollar
item.description: Base metals and gold prices were higher, with a weaker dollar supporting commodities backed by the greenback.

item.title: Oil Jumps Amid Red Sea Houthi Ship Attacks
item.description: Oil prices moved sharply higher after attacks on ships in the Red Sea by rebel Houthi forces added to worries that the war in Gaza could spread further into the Middle East.

item.title: Bond Market Valuations Are Seen Ambitious
item.description: Bond markets enter the new year at ambitious valuations, with 10-year Bund yields trading around 2% and almost 165 basis points of ECB interest-rate cuts priced in for 2024, Commerzbank Research said.
